where Z
i is the atomic weight and ρ
i is the density of component i. For the Ti–Ni–Cu ternary system, since t
i changes linearly along the direction of the mask movement, while ρ
i / Z
i varies with the element, the compositional coordinates are not linear to the spatial coordinates. Thus, the evenly distributed measurement data points are most concentrated around the corner of Ni, with the highest ρ
i / Z
i ratio and the least concentrated around Ti corner in the compositional coordinates, as shown in Fig. 7.
